message: Also, here is the link to the color contrast analyzer and color blindeness preview app. For both Mac and Windows. http://www.paciellogroup.com/resources/contrast-analyser.html#download

Here are links to me presentation as PDF, Keynote and PowerPoint.
http://stuff.sethburnett.com/Be-Awesome.zip

The original 2-hour talk that I tried to condense and do service to can be found here: http://greyscalegorilla.com/blog/2011/02/the-creative-gap-becoming-better-than-most/
love that topic and i think you did awesome with it
Thanks @ericzanol. I'm trying to think up what to do for another talk. I have a couple ideas possibly, but I'll post that in the March 8 discussion not here.
If someone wants to borrow Predictably Irrational, let me know and I can bring it to the next meetup, if someone from work doesn't snag it from me first.
Side-note, I'm not intending this to be a chat for me to follow-up on my talk but a hub where we can place links and such that we may have mentioned during our talks.
Here's the public link to my slides on Motivation; it most importantly has the name and books for the two authors mentioned as sources: http://portal.sliderocket.com/ANFAO/Motivation
i put all my links over on meetup. wasn't sure where would be best. http://www.meetup.com/doctype-society/messages/boards/thread/10454024/
Here's my post on re-using backbone models on the server: http://andyet.net/blog/2011/feb/15/re-using-backbonejs-models-on-the-server-with-node/#disqus_thread
Here's an excellent example of using WebGL for 3D rendering: http://www.chromeexperiments.com/detail/body-browser/?f=webgl
And if you haven't checked it out before, browse through the other WebGL demos on Chrome Experiments, they're pretty sweet.
@jkessie Please run with this, we have a lot of designer/UI types in the group and we all need to work together in the real world, so learning basic theories or gotchas would help!
http://files.meetup.com/1765402/DuetranopeExample.png
Here are my slides from tonight's talk on some of the lessons I learned when I was freelancing: http://www.slideshare.net/adambrault/freelance-fundamentals
Totally bummed that I couldn't make it. Nice slides Adam, Thanks!
@adambrault Love the slides. I'm sure I would have loved them even more if I could have made it last night and partook of the dialogue that accompanied each.
Personally, I'd love to see the beard speech on here as well.
Ditto on the beard speech.
For those of you that saw my live demo fail miserably after contacting dotcloud it turns out they did fix it right before the talk!!!!
ha! that's awesome!
